The system is subjected to a transformation \\( f(z) = e^{i\\omega t}z \\) where \\( \\omega \\) is a real constant representing a frequency.

With knowledge of the state \\( z(T) \\), can we definitively determine which transformations (either \\( f(z) \\), \\( g(z) \\), or both) were applied during the interval from 0 to T?
Explanation: Due to the independence in the phase modifications caused by \\( e^{i\\omega t} \\) and \\( e^{\\alpha t} \\) and their compounded effect, dissecting the precise contributions from each without additional data on when or how these transformations were applied is impossible. Multiple scenarios could lead to the same observed \\( z(T) \\), rendering the causal pathway indeterminate.
